_meanings:
The son of 
Kṛtavīrya and king of the Haihayas, who
ruled at Māhiṣmatī. [Having 
worshipped Dattātreya, he obtained from
him several boons, such as a thousand
arms, a golden chariot that went 
wheresoever he willed it to go, the power of
restraining wrong by justice, conquest
of earth, invincibility by enemies &c.;
(<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>R. 6. 39</ls>). According to the Vāyu
Purāṇa he ruled justly and righteously
for 85000 years and offered 10000 
sacrifices. He was a contemporary of
Ravaṇa whom he once captured and
confined like a beast in a corner of his
city; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>R. 6. 40.</ls> Kārtavīrya was
slain by Paraśurāma for having carried
off by violence the Kāmadhenu of his
revered father Jamadagni. Kārtavīrya 

is also known by the name 
Sahasrārjuna.].
